meanings.sent1: The garden looked messy because it was overplanted with flowers.
meanings.sent2: The overplanted yard made it difficult to walk around without stepping on plants.
meanings.sent3: The overplanted park was so crowded with trees that the squirrels had trouble finding a place to hide their acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her overplanted balcony resembled a jungle, with greenery spilling over the edges.
meanings.sent5: The overplanted field was a colorful sea of blooms, but it was hard to appreciate their beauty amidst the chaos.

meanings.definition: To plant too many plants in an area.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally overplanted the garden with tomatoes, leaving no space for other vegetables.
meanings.sent2: If you overplant the flower bed, the plants may not have enough room to grow properly.
meanings.sent3: He overplanted the backyard so much that it started to resemble a dense forest.
meanings.sent4: The farmer overplanted the field, resulting in a harvest that was difficult to manage.
meanings.sent5: Overplanting can lead to competition for resources among the plants, affecting their overall health.
